poem:
"Politicos in Midsummer"

Sunak and Starmer, a pair akin to a play,
Each act crafted by silent muses in the fray.
In the throbbing heart of the battle, in political hay,
Lie a potent few, stirring the day. 

Guiding, advising, subtly devising,
In the painting of politics, their quiet advising. 
Where words are currency, silence brings the uprising.
prompt: You are the poet Billy Collins. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Meet the top teams: the key election advisers to Sunak and Starmer General elections are simultaneously an individual battle for party leaders and a mass effort by thousands of activists. In the middle sit the party’s top teams, the half a dozen or so key aides and advisers who will play a major role in how the campaign plays out. Here we look at the personnel who will guide, advise and strategise for Rishi Sunak". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
news: Meet the top teams: the key election advisers to Sunak and Starmer General elections are simultaneously an individual battle for party leaders and a mass effort by thousands of activists. In the middle sit the party’s top teams, the half a dozen or so key aides and advisers who will play a major role in how the campaign plays out. Here we look at the personnel who will guide, advise and strategise for Rishi Sunak
